did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: University of Arizona Liberal Arts Lectures 1927-1967

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Arizona. College of Liberal Arts.

did.abstract: The collection contains typscript copies of the lectures given by University of Arizona faculty as part of the long running College of Liberal Arts lecture series. Notable speakers were: A.E. Douglas, Edwin Carpenter, Frances Gillmor, Emil Haury, Robert L. Nugent, and Edward Spicer.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). The user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Arizona Board of Regents for the University of Arizona, its officers, employees, and agents from and against all claims made by any person asserting that he or she is an owner of copyright.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: University of Arizona Liberal Arts Lectures (AZ 113). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: v.1. Lectures 1 to 17; v.2. Lectures 18 to 25; v.3. Lectures 26 to 32; v.4. Lectures 33 to 40.

controlaccess.corpname: University of Arizona. College of Liberal Arts -- History.
